Build-Depends: debhelper-compat (= 13), dh-sequence-python3, pybuild-plugin-pyproject, python3-all, python3-pytest (>= 9) <!nocheck>, python3-pytest-mpl <!nocheck>, python3-setuptools, python3-setuptools-scm, python3-typing-extensions
Description: Parsing using Python typing The idea behind flexparser is quite simple. To write a class for every type of content (called here `ParsedStatement`) one needs to parse. Each class have a `from_string` constructor. The `typing` module is used extensively to make the output structure easy to use and less error prone. . The fuse of frozen dataclass is not necessary but it convenient. Being a dataclass you get the init, str, repr, etc for free. Being frozen, sort of immutable, makes them easier to reason around. . The result is a collection of `ParsedStatement` or `ParsingError`.
